length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short ball on the pads and he gets on the back foot to whip this in front square. Long leg has some running to do
tossed up at leg stump, mistimed drive to mid-on
full on leg stump, driven back to the bowler who tries to deflect it onto the stumps but ends up giving them a free run at mid-off
tossed up at leg stump, taps to mid-on with the full face offered
length ball just outside off, defended on the front foot
short of a length in the corridor, defended to point off the back foot
slashed away. Short and wide from Jayed and people quicker than him wouldn't have got away with that. At his 120kph, this chop through point is particularly easy
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length ball wide outside off, left alone
full on leg stump, drilled to mid-on off the front foot
pitched up on off, driven to mid-on
waits for it to turn and bounce before tapping through the gully region
looped up outside off, drilled back
length, turns away on off, blocked
back of a length, keeps little low, whipped from the backfoot to midwicket
full on off, blocked
fuller one, sliding on leg, pushed out off the front foot
full on off, defended
full, clipped to midwicket
pitched up on middle, and that's been smoked out of here. Heaved over long-on
short of a length, spins away, defended
full on off, driven to cover
full, tucked off the pads to square leg
short, spinning away, cut to sweeper cover
full on leg stump, clipped to long-on
full, drilled off the inside of the bat to the bowler
defended down the pitch
back of a length, shuffles across and blocks
bowled around the legs. Done in by lack of turn as he gets down for a sweep with the front foot across but the ball comes on with the arm and takes out the stumps
full on the pads, turned away to midwicket
length around off, defended off the front foot
full on leg, clipped to square leg
huge appeal for caught behind but that may have gone past the outside edge. A non-turning length ball that does the batsman in as he plays for turn
full on the stumps, pushed out to the off side
full, driven to cover
length ball that slides down the leg side
full on middle and off, blocked
slides in and pings the pad in front of leg. Missing
accurate lines on the stumps, defended
length on off, backs away and blocks to the off side
full, flicked to midwicket
shuffles across and keeps the bat inside as it comes on with the arm
looped up on middle and spins in to miss everything and lob behind square

tame dismissal! You'd think when a batsman is stepping down the track at this stage he's looking to clear the boundary or something. Instead Holder is left just feeling for a non-turner after charging down, leaving Nurul to complete a straightforward stumping
sliding back of a length delivery, goes to fine leg off the pad
fuller one, no turn, goes off the outside of the bat to the off side
shortish and some width, cut away through backward point
flat, back of a length, flicked to midwicket
plays for the turn but gets hit on the pad as it comes on with the turn. Think a mild edge might have saved him
back of a length, spins in, punched to midwicket
gets across off and blocks down the pitch
goes for an expansive drive and the ball spins in but misses the stumps
shuffles across to a length ball and bunts it out
full outside off, driven through the gap at covers for a brace
sharp turn, hits the pad but clearly going down leg
bowled him! That's the ninth West Indies wicket, and fifth for Shakib - his 18th in Tests. Goes right past prod and taking out the stumps. Variable turn doing it again
length, spins away, gently taps it to cover
was that bat first? Appeal for lbw turned down as he's struck in front

this one seems closer but height may have been the issue. Anyway, they refer this upstairs. Sliding on middle and hitting the pad as it comes on with the angle. But it's another inside edge, it seems, as there's a deflection before hitting the pad. Yup, confirmed
and again, hitting the pad, but with that angle, going well down leg
middle stump uprooted. A wild heave across the line and turn and again done in by lack of turn. Just comes on with the arm and takes out the stumps
fullish length, strides out and defends to point with an open face
good length on middle, defended
full, drifts down the leg side as he tries to clip it away
back of a length, angles down the leg side, left alone
full on middle, driven back
angled in from wide of the crease and raps him on the pad. Tough to get the shout in his favour with that angle
short of a length, drifts away outside off as he lets it go
slight shape away but too wide to make him play in the first place
short of a length on off, defended
full outside off, leans into a drive through cover
short of a length, straightens subtly to beat the outside edge
full outside off, crunched to extra cover

that one kept low, and Tamim is in trouble. Cuts back in from just back of a length and Tamim has his bat outside the line of the delivery. Raps him in front of middle and leg and looked pretty plumb. S Ravi upholds the appeal. Tamim reviews only to find out that the ball would've crashed into middle and leg
short of a length, cuts in, blocked from the crease
did that take the inside edge? Sticks the bat out away from the body and the ball jags back in before bouncing just in front of the keeper
short ball, arches back to let it go outside off
short of a length on middle, pretty accurate, blocked out
back of a length at 123ks, Mominul tucks through square leg to avoid a pair
slips out of the hand, a full toss, that's pushed back towards mid-off
short of good length around off, defended
good length on off, blocked solidly into the off side
short of good length, tucked around to square leg
inside edge saves him there as this fuller one curves in and pings the pad
full, curving in on middle and leg, and Mominul presents the full face of his bat to carve it through long-on
shot. Short of a length and skidding in nicely for the dab past gully. Stayed deep and allowed that to come on
short ball fired down leg side
short and wide outside off, left alone
traps him on the back foot but that's going high and they withdraw the appeal. Jags back from a length and catches him in front of off stump
length ball with slight shape away outside off, left alone
short of a length and in at the fourth stump. Defended solidly on the back foot
length ball bowled very wide outside off. Left alone
good length and in at off stump. Taps it into the covers with soft hands to steal the single
overpitched and wide outside off. Reaches out and jams it through cover. Point gives chase and pulls it back

inswinging yorker speared in at off stump. Watches it closely and manages to dig it out...oh but was that pad first? Yes it was. But WI weren't confident about it. Would have been very very close on the review. Would have been out, in fact.
short ball fired down leg side, left alone
short of a length on off, defended off the back foot
gets it over gully off the turf. This short ball cramps him, but he backs away and chops it into the floor to get it over the fielder
length on off stump, defended off the back foot

chips it over mid-on. Full ball on off stump, meets it at the pitch and uses his wrists to hit from under this. He likes playing this shot. It's what got him out in the first Test, but this was executed perfectly
length and sliding in low at off stump. Watchfully defended into the leg side
drilled. Liton is in the mood. This is a full outswinger outside off and he crashes it past mid-off
and another. Full control from Liton, every ball of that over. This is short outside off and he deflects it between second slip and gully with an open face
short and wide outside off, half-slash and beaten
beaten. Lovely ball. Angled in at the corridor, leaving the batsman off the pitch. Past the outside edge
beaten again. Short of a length and angled into him. He fishes inside the line
length outside off, big forward stride to defend
full ball down leg side, looks to flick and can't get bat on it
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
short and wide outside off, slashes and is beaten on the outside edge
length ball swinging away wide outside off, left alone
lovely. Short ball outside off and he spanks him off the front foot, launching him over midwicket
bouncer over the stumps as he looks to defend. This length ball keeps low as he gets behind to defend
full on off stump, check-drive to mid-off's left
full ball slanted down leg side, can't connect on the flick
short ball at leg stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
short-ish on off stump. This doesn't rise a lot but he has hit it with a horizontal bat. Swipes from just above knee height. Fine leg puts in a slide to his left
short of a length outside off, zips away off the surface and past his bat as he looks to defend
short and into the hips. Whipped to fine leg
length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
length ball at middle stump, plants the front leg across and jabs it into the leg side
shot ball rising steeply outside off. Zooms past the outside edge after squaring the batsman up
beaten again. They're angling it in to him and he's still uncertain. Keeps hanging the bat out
short ball down leg side, left alone
short ball skidding low in the corridor, defended off the bottom of the bat
short of a length outside off, mistimed punch into the covers
short and into the body. Defended off the back foot
length, hint of outswing, but wide outside off. Left alone
length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
past the inside edge. Another one that keeps low, but Liton really should have been forward to that
late swing away outside off, left alone

got him at gully! Yet another start from Liton, yet another promise of patience, yet another loose shot. Disappointing from the opener, who was looking fluent today. Went after a length ball, the kind he's been leaving. He's not someone who usually gets a big stride in. And that is the case here. Keemo Paul has been sixth stump line with shape away and when you look to drive that line without feet, you won't have a lot of success. Edge carries straight to gully at shin height
full and wide outside off. Leans in and caresses this through the covers
full outside off, left alone
length on off stump, defended solidly on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, left alone
short and wide. Chases and misses.
class. Short of a length outside off and he gets on top of the bounce and punches through point
length outside off, defended with a big forward stride
length ball on the pads, nudged to fine leg off the inside half of the bat
length ball into the pads. Deflected to fine leg's left off the pads
length outside off, pushed on the up, away from the body, to cover
length on off stump. Drives on the up again. Mistimed. Rolls out to mid-off
overpitched outside off, punched to mid-off off the front foot
length and in at off stump. Blocked on the front foot
drifted in at off stump on a length. Dead-batted into the pitch
drags him forward with a loopy one outside off. Driven to cover
length ball angled in and hits his pad in front of leg stump as he gets on the back foot
lovely shot. Waits for this full one to land in his zone and drives it through extra cover. Nice forward stride on that one

he's been given lbw and has reviewed it. A strange sequence this. He got on the front foot, missed a slider and was hit in front of middle stump as the ball went past the inside edge. Looked very close up front but no one seemed excited. The appeal did come eventually though and S Ravi made a slow, laboured signal for out...and he was right! Sliding straight onto hit leg stump. Mominul has played for the turn and he's gone at the stroke of tea.
tries to flick and gets hit on the pad outside off
length outside off, defended
full on the pads, flicked to deep square leg where Cummins moves across swiftly and fails to contain himself doing so, letting the ball pass through to the boundary
sharp angle as it angles in and raps the pad. Missing leg as evident from their half-hearted appeal
just back of a length on off, defended
full on off, pushed to mid-off
length, cuts in to find the inside of the bat to square leg
full on off, driven to long-on
reaches out for this one and inside edges to the pad
pitched up on off, hammers a drive wide of long-off
backs away and tries to force a cut with no room and gets beaten
full on off, defended
pitched up outside off, driven to long-on
full, angling in, pushed past mid-on
good length on off, defended to cover. Surprise surprise! A no-ball!
back of a length, pushed back from front of leg
full, pushed across off, driven to mid-off
full, angled across, driven past extra cover's right. Authoritative stroke
full, angled in, flicked to square leg
pushed back to the bowler
walks across towards off and then defends back

gone! Shai Hope puts in a well-timed dive at midwicket to take an overhead catch. An outrageous shot, comes down the track and tries to take the aggressive route in drilling it. Doesn't bother to keep it down and chips a catch
length, turn and bounce, raps Rahim on the pad. Half-hearted appeal for lbw, turned down because of height
blocks a length ball from the crease

can it get any closer? Bangladesh continue to bat mindlessly. Rahim backs away and tries to force cut but doesn't account for the ball spitting back in and taking the inside edge before dropping centimeters short of the stumps
drifts down the leg side
offers up room outside off and Shakib's going after it. Slashes hard and flays it through backward point
back of a length, opens the face and punches it past backward point diving to his right
full on off, driven back
flicked off the pads behind square
full, straight, left alone outside off
big turn off the cracks outside off, slashes and misses
back of a length, spinning away on off, shuffles across and blocks
back of a length, slight turn, covers for it and blocks to cover
draws him forward and then gets it to rip away past the outside edge
yes and no! That's exactly what they don't want. Rahim takes off even as Shakib belts out a no. Luckily cover fumbles and Rahim survives
full, clipped away through midwicket with the angle
short, gets a little big on him but he does well to keep it down
good length, turned away with the angle to midwicket
short of a length on off, defends off the outside of the bat
full, curves in and takes the inside of the bat this time
length around off, defended
gets down for a reverse sweep and knocks it through the gully region for four
just short of a length, spins in sharply and he goes for the pull, does not time it too well and the edge gets past backward short leg
shifts back and whips against the turn to midwicket
strides across and blocks watchfully into the off side
pushes down to long-on
full on middle, defended
full, angled in, clipped to midwicket
there! Another loose, extravagant shot outside off and gets beaten
short, wide, stands tall and cuts in front of square
back of a length, keeps low, chops through to the slip on the bounce
fullish length, driven towards extra cover
short ball, and another no-ball
good length, flicked to midwicket
spinning away from a fuller length, driven hard to extra cover
length, shuffles across and blocks
full around off, defended into the off side
cuts with the turn to point who misfields but they decide against the turn
full outside off, driven to mid-off
presses forward and gets an outside edge to slip
back of a length, shuffles across and blocks
length outside off, blocked
back of a length outside off, punched away to cover
full, angled in, clipped off the pads to deep fine leg
full, angled in on the stumps, Mushfiqur presents the full face of his bat and caresses it down the ground
length outside off, shuffles and blocks
pushed back to the right of the bowler
straightens outside off, left alone
similar delivery, a little closer but Shakib's sure of his off stump and lets it go
more turn this time as he shuffles across and lets it go
back of a length, blocked in front of off
full outside off, pushed to mid-off
angled in from wide of the crease and then shaping away, left alone
outside edge falls short of slip. Squares him up with some extra bounce but fortunately for Rahim the ball went off the glove
accurate on the stumps, variable bounce again but he manages to keep it out
pushes away from the body and gets an outside edge through backward point
Shakib rolls out a red carpet along the straight boundary to welcome him back. Glorious straight drive
shortish, takes the back hand off as he slaps to backward point
another overpitched delivery, another boundary. Through mid-on this time
overcompensates with the length and fires it short and wide, Shakib capitalises with a slap through backward point
that's better - a yorker that's dug out
hangs the bat outside off and guides to point with an open face
short, angled down leg, tries to pull and doesn't make contact
walks into a forward thrust and the ball jags away to beat the edge
even sharper movement this time but he reaches out and carves a drive through point
length, finds the inside of the bat to midwicket
full on the pads, pushed between midwicket and mid-on
short of a length, shuffles and blocks
full inswinger, clipped behind square for one
full, pushed across, driven to mid-off
shortish, down the leg side, left alone
back of a length, angled across, reaches out but it keeps low and sneaks underneath
full, pushed across, driven to mid-off
short of a length, angled across, bit of variable bounce again as he fails to put bat to it
cuts in sharply from a length and raps the pad

that's the wicket West Indies were looking for. The seniormost pair has been broken up. Cuts in off the deck and grazes the inside edge before crashing into the stumps. Rahim pays for leaving a big gap between bat and pad

is it yesterday? Nurul, the second in a pair again. Out for a golden duck again. First ball lbw, caught on the move again. Wow. Length ball angled in at off and his front foot plonk across has cost him again. Of course, yesterday he was struck outside the line. Today, there isn't even the option to review.

oh this is really close! Mehidy shuffles a long way across and is struck in front by a yorker. Leg stump's visible. Not out says the umpire and the captain, the man on a hat trick, won't review. It was going down.
short of a length on off stump, tapped into the off side
full ball in at off stump, punched to mid-off
length ball down leg side. Shuffles and looks to flick, can't connect
beautiful. Mehidy, very classy as he leans into this. Overpitched outside off and the weight has gone through his firm hands as he gets this wide of mid-off
ouch. This climbs into his body and gets him on the body as he looks to defend on the back foot
short of a length wide outside off, stabbed to point off the back foot
nice looking shot again. Short of a length outside off, punched to point with a high elbow. A misfield there will give him some runs
and another pleasing shot. Late awayswing at a good length outside off. Drives on the up through cover with full balance
length ball down leg side, shuffles and can't get connect on the flick
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length and in at off stump. Looks to drive through cover, gets it off the inside half and it trickles through to the long-on fence
short of a length outswinger, rises up on him as he looks to defend on the back foot
length outside off, solidly blocked
short of a length and in at middle stump, tapped into the leg side with soft hands
sneaks through from under Dowrich. Short ball down leg side, dies on the keeper
length ball outside off, swings hard at it to be beaten on the inside edge

snapped at second slip by Devon Smith, who would have regretted it if he didn't take this! A big dive to his left from second slip as this was flying straight to Holder at first. But he holds on. Short ball outside off, gets too big on him as he looks to cut. A thick-ish edge and the end draws closer
yorker wide outside off. He chases it and is beaten
length ball wobbling outside off. Pokes at it and is beaten
length at the stumps, pushed to mid-off
short and wide outside off, left alone
length ball swung in at off stump. Opens the face and drives on the up through cover

nice shot followed by a comical effort from Gabriel, who has managed to fake himself with his footwork, then has run back in despair, put in a big dive, and nearly taken out Powell running across from deep midwicket. It's still four. A gentle push from Shakib, leaning into the full ball at middle stump and Gabriel loses it to his left at mid-on
short of a length outside off, chopped to point
short and wide outside off. Slashes hard at this and is beaten by the extra bounce
outside edge falls short. Length ball headed for the top of middle. He leaps off the floor as he defends from inside the line. Second slip puts his body behind this
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler
length on middle stump, exposes the stumps as he defends into the off side from the crease
full and very wide outside off. Left alone
length ball outside off, beaten as he drives on the up, from inside the line
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
struck on the left elbow. This ball angles in, straightens and climbs up as Shakib shapes to try and flick this
crafty. Short and in the corridor. Still angling in so he has to adjust his body to make room. Guides it between second slip and gully
big inswinger. Tailing in at leg stump and he nearly gets caught with the front leg across. Flicks to deep square
shot! Full inswinger and he gets on his back knee to drill a nice looking shot through cover
length on off, contorts and jabs this back at the bowler
length on off, defended into the covers
length on leg stump. Cops it on the pad as he looks to flick
tossed up at off stump, pushed to extra cover off the front foot
short of a length outside off, left alone
short of a length on leg stump, tickled fine off the back foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short and wide and he slaps it to the point boundary. That's fifty for Shakib, a well-compiled innings as the world crumbles around him
leading edge into the covers. Closes the face too early on this full ball at the stumps
thick outside edge and a misfield at point. Again, looking to force this full ball with no balance
full and in at off stump. Stabs to mid-off and calls late for the run. Safe, though.
length ball on the pads. Deflected to fine leg off the pad as he looks to flick

knocks his leg stump! What a ball from Holder to get his counterpart! Breaches the defences. And that looks like a bit of reverse swing too. Natural angle from around the wicket has Shakib looking to drive on the up against this length ball, through the covers by the way his bat is pointed. But the late swing has brought this back even further and zipped through the gate to make a scrumptious mess of the stumps
keeps low but the batsman manages to get bat on this to keep it out. Length ball skidding low at off stump
inswinger, at a length, headed for the stumps. Backs away and slices into the off side
full on middle stump, flicked to mid-on
short of a length on off, cramped as he looks to pull this
nice pick-up shot. Length ball swung into the pads and he uses the angle to whip it aerially through square leg
full ball outside off, squeezed through point off the thick outside edge as he looks to drive through cover
swipes and misses. A length ball too wide for him to make contact with

that's five and it's ten! Dead plumb. Length ball, keeping low, batsman trapped on the crease trying to defend. He's caught it on the back leg right in front of middle. No doubt about this. First ten-wicket match haul for Holder. Best figures by a West Indies captain at home. Not to mention, his third five-wicket haul in the last six innings. I believe it's also the wicket that brings his bowling average under 30. What a moment.
length ball at off stump. Backs away and exposes the stumps. Just gets the bat in the way to defend this
full on middle stump, flicked to square leg
short ball outside off, steered to gully off the back foot
length ball in the corridor, pushed behind square on the off side off the thick outside edge

and now he grabs his best bowling figures! Why not? A yorker at leg stump that's too good for No. 11. Six for 59 for Holder. Bangladesh have been cleaned up cheaply, yet again, and this is another massive win for West Indies.
